title: This teen invented a watch that warns you about touching your face so you don't catch coronavirus
description: We touch our faces for many reasons: to groom, to gesture, to scratch. The act can even be soothing in times of stress.

title: 28 family members test positive for coronavirus
description: 60-year-old Vidal Garay died after contracting the coronavirus and at least 28 family members have tested positive. CNN's Paul Vercammen spoke with Garay's son Richard about the impact the virus has had on the family.

title: Pence changes course: 'Wearing a mask is a good idea'
description: During an appearance with Texas Gov. Greg Abbott in Dallas, Vice President Mike Pence made a push for wearing a face mask to protect from coronavirus after months of not publicly doing so. CNN's Sarah Westwood has more.

title: These masks do more than prevent coronavirus
description: See how innovators are improving face masks so that preventing coronavirus is not the only thing they do. CNN's Michael Holmes has the story.

title: Trump denies being briefed on Russian bounty intelligence
description: President Donald Trump on Sunday denied receiving a briefing about intelligence that Russians had tried to bribe Taliban fighters to kill US troops, as The New York Times first reported and CNN has confirmed.

title: Russian intelligence officers offered cash rewards to Taliban fighters to kill US, UK troops in Afghanistan, source says
Trump campaign removed social distancing stickers before Tulsa rally - report
Arjen Robben to make comeback with first club Groningen
description: Arjen Robben, one of the top footballers in Dutch history, is coming out of retirement to help his first club during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Black man said he was afraid to walk in his neighborhood. So hundreds joined him.
description: Hundreds of people in a Tennessee man's community are marching by his side after he shared his fears of walking in his neighborhood because he is Black.

title: A man was fatally shot at protests over the killing of Breonna Taylor
description: A man was fatally shot at a park in Louisville, Kentucky, where peaceful protesters have been gathering to demand justice for the killing of Breonna Taylor.

title: Why isn't Harriet Tubman on the $20 bill yet?
description: Money talks. It's an adage ingrained in the minds of the American consumer. Our country's wealth speaks volumes when the US asserts its prominence on the global stage, and our President's wealth was touted as a credential for his candidacy during the 2016 election.

title: Fiji markets itself as retreat for billionaires during pandemic
The US is more alone than ever, just at the moment the world needs its leadership
description: The United States is in uncharted territory, on an exponential path to becoming a Covid-19 pariah and an unreliable ally to its friends.

title: 10,000-bed Covid-19 facility set to open in India
DNA evidence points to 8-year-old's killer after 38 years
description: After nearly 38 agonizing years, the family of Kelly Ann Prosser finally has some closure.

title: After weeks of protests, meaningful police reform appears unlikely
description: The dramatic images rocked the nation -- hundreds of thousands of people from all races taking to the streets across the United States, demanding an end to excessive police force against people of color.

title: Only two US states report decline in new coronavirus cases
description: Only two US states are reporting a decline in new coronavirus cases compared to last week -- Connecticut and Rhode Island.

title: Jamaica's governor-general suspends personal use of royal insignia over 'offending image'
description: Jamaica's governor-general will no longer wear a royal insignia that appears to depict a White man stepping on the head of a Black man.

title: Shooting of Zimbabwe workers by Chinese mine owner shows 'systemic' abuse, watchdog says
description: The shooting of two Zimbabwean workers by a Chinese boss shows the "systematic and widespread" abuse that locals face in Chinese mining operations, says the Zimbabwe Environmental Law Society (ZELA).

title: This is what space smells like
description: Space, the final fragrance.

title: Source: Russia offered Taliban fighters rewards to kill US and UK troops in Afghanistan
description: US intelligence concluded months ago that Russian military intelligence offered bounties to Taliban-linked militants to kill coalition forces in Afghanistan, including US troops, amid peace talks, according to a New York Times report published Friday.

title: Trump campaign removed social distancing stickers before Tulsa rally - report
description:
• Analysis: Trump's unpopularity isn't new. It's his normal state.
• Analysis: Trump's resistance to mask wearing says it all

title: Here's what percentage of Biden's staff are people of color
description: Joe Biden's presidential campaign on Saturday reported diversity data for its staff for the first time, disclosing that more than one-third of the presumptive democratic nominee's staff is comprised of people of color and is majority female.

title: Colorado protesters shut down highway calling for justice in the death of Elijah McClain
description: Colorado protesters shut down Highway 225 Saturday in a peaceful demonstration calling for justice in the death of Elijah McClain.

title: Can millions more street vendors save China from a jobs crisis? Beijing appears divided
description: For years, China staked its future on world class manufacturing and new technology. Now, it's having to contemplate a simpler, and older, solution to its looming jobs crisis involving millions more street vendors — and the idea is exposing divisions in Beijing.
